bropals.lib.simplegame.leveldesigner

Interface EditableEntity

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEditableEntity

    public interface EditableEntity
    Interface for making something editable in the level editor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      EditableEntity copy()
      Copies this EditableEntity for the copy function.
      java.lang.String[] getEditableFields()
      Get the list of property names that should be editable by the property editor in the level editor.
      java.lang.String getFieldValue(java.lang.String propertyName)
      Gets the text for the field based on the property.
      float getHeight()
      Gets the height of the editable entity in world coordinates.
      int getRenderLayer()
      Gets the render layer that this EditableEntity belongs in.
      float getWidth()
      Gets the width of the editable entity in world coordinates.
      float getX()
      Gets the x position of the editable entity in world coordinates.
      float getY()
      Gets the y position of the editable entity in world coordinates.
      void renderForLevelEditor(java.awt.Graphics g, int cameraOffsetX, int cameraOffsetY)
      Renders this entity for the level editor.
      java.lang.String setFieldValue(java.lang.String propertyName, java.lang.String valueName)
      Sets the field value for the property based on the field text.

      void setRenderLayer(int layer) 
      void setWidth(float width) 
      void setX(float x) 
      void setY(float y)

      • setRenderLayer

        void setRenderLayer(int layer)

      • setX

        void setX(float x)

      • setY

        void setY(float y)

        void setWidth(float width)

      • setHeight

        void setHeight(float height)

      • getRenderLayer

        int getRenderLayer()
        Gets the render layer that this EditableEntity belongs in. Objects that are farther away from the camera, and are drawn last, should have a higher render layer value.
        Returns:
        the render layer this EditableEntity belongs in.

      • getX

        float getX()
        Gets the x position of the editable entity in world coordinates.
        Returns:
        the y position in world coordinates.

      • getY

        float getY()
        Gets the y position of the editable entity in world coordinates.
        Returns:
        the y position in world coordinates.

      • getWidth

        float getWidth()
        Gets the width of the editable entity in world coordinates.
        Returns:
        the width in world coordinates.

      • getHeight

        float getHeight()
        Gets the height of the editable entity in world coordinates.
        Returns:
        the height in world coordinates.

      • getEditableFields

        java.lang.String[] getEditableFields()
        Get the list of property names that should be editable by the property editor in the level editor.
        Returns:
        the list of property names for this editable object.

      • getFieldValue

        java.lang.String getFieldValue(java.lang.String propertyName)
        Gets the text for the field based on the property. This exists because all property fields may not be equals.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the name of the property that is requesting a field text.
        Returns:
        the field text for that property.

      • setFieldValue

        java.lang.String setFieldValue(java.lang.String propertyName,
                               java.lang.String valueName)
        Sets the field value for the property based on the field text. If there was an error with the field, then this function returns the field that would fix the field.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the name of the property to set
        valueName - the field text to set the property value.
        Returns:
        null if the value was correctly set, otherwise, the field text that indicates an error in the field text.

      • renderForLevelEditor

        void renderForLevelEditor(java.awt.Graphics g,
                          int cameraOffsetX,
                          int cameraOffsetY)
        Renders this entity for the level editor.
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics context to draw
        cameraOffsetX - the camera offset x
        cameraOffsetY - the camera offset y

      • copy

        EditableEntity copy()
        Copies this EditableEntity for the copy function.
        Returns:
        a copied instance of this entity.
